snippet: Offshore arrangements made through Mitt Romney’s former company, Bain Capital, were part of tax-avoidance strategies that have enhanced his income.
abstract: Review of Mitt Romney's tax returns finds that offshore arrangements made through his former company Bain Capital were part of tax-avoidance strategies that have enhanced his income; Bain, as well as other private equity firms, goes to great lengths to minimize the taxes borne by its investors, substantially increasing their wealth.

byline.original: By MICHAEL LUO and MIKE McINTIRE

lead_paragraph: Offshore arrangements made through Mitt Romney’s former company, Bain Capital, were part of tax-avoidance strategies that have enhanced his income.

headline.seo: Bain’s Offshore Strategies Grew Romneys’ Wealth
headline.main: Offshore Tactics Helped Increase Romneys’ Wealth
headline.print_headline: Offshore Set-Ups Helped Romneys Increase Wealth
